description: Decimal expansion of square root of 96.
comments: Continued fraction expansion is 9 followed by {1, 3, 1, 18} repeated. - _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 11 2009This differs only by offset from 2*(6^(1/2))/5 = 0.9797958971132712392789... as used in Theorem 5, equation 1.8, p.4 of Cao. - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Apr 29 2010
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Zhenwei Cao, Alexander Elgart, On efficiency of Hamiltonian--based quantum computation for low-rank matrices, April 27, 2010. [From _Jonathan Vos Post_, Apr 29 2010]
prog: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 20080); x=sqrt(96); for (n=1, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b010547.txt", n, " ", d)); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 11 2009
crossrefs: Cf. A010167 Continued fraction. - _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 11 2009
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: Final digits of sequence corrected using the b-file. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 30 2009
